H0.text: Cell is the location where nutrients are directly absorbed from the bloodstream.

H1.text: Organ is the structure in which nutrients are directly absorbed from the bloodstream.

H2.text: Organisms are the entities in which nutrients are directly absorbed from the bloodstream.

H3.text: Tissue is where nutrients are directly absorbed from the bloodstream.

A4.text: 95% of nutrient absorption occurs in the small intestine.

A5.text: The intestinal walls are lined with villi, and their epithelial cells are covered with numerous microvilli to improve the absorption of nutrients by increasing the surface area of the intestine.

A6.text: The small intestine is the site where most of the absorption of nutrients from ingested food takes place.

A7.text: The epithelial cells of the villi transport nutrients from the lumen of the intestine into capillaries and lacteals.
